column4: they opened the source in 1998 - but moz ia a complete re-write anyway
1) debian distros use .xsession 2) you write it yourself
youdid a dist-upgrade, right ? Not just upgrade ?
no just upgrade
you need to dist-upgrade :)
doh!
bah! im just going to do a fresh install of breezy since i already have the iso. it is saying that it will download 300+ meg
that sounds about right
ls -l /dev/cdrom
at the end  of the line -> hdc for example
thanks im burning breezy colony 5 from cdrecord
/etc/hdparm.conf IIRC
yeah i did that as wiki says but its not working
you can use commands in /etc/init.d/bootmisc.sh (but it's deprecated)
i ran that and it didn't do anything
then I'm running out of ideas - Works For Me (tm)
what is that script supposed to do?
it's a start up script for "miscellaneous" things you want to start on boot
you can add stuff to it at the end, before the exit
i figured it out
had /dev/hdc instead of /dev/cdrom
ah well it has to point at the right device of course :)
